1.verse_text: The oracle (a burdensome message–a pronouncement from God) which Habakkuk the prophet saw. And You will not hear? I cry out to You, 'Violence!' Yet You do not save. And cause me to look on wickedness? For destruction and violence are before me; Strife continues and contention arises. And justice is never upheld, For the wicked surround the righteous; Therefore, justice becomes perverted. Be astonished! Wonder! For I am doing something in your days– You would not believe it if you were told. That fierce and impetuous nation Who march throughout the earth To take possession of dwelling places that do not belong to them. Their justice and authority originate with themselves and are defined only by their decree. And keener than [hungry] wolves in the evening, Their horsemen come galloping, Their horsemen come from far away; They fly like an eagle swooping down to devour. Their horde of faces moves [eagerly] forward, They gather prisoners like sand. And rulers are a laughing matter to them. They ridicule every stronghold And heap up rubble [for earth mounds] and capture it. But they will be held guilty, They [and all men] whose own power and strength is their god.' O L ord , my God, My Holy One? We will not die. O L ord , You have appointed the Chaldeans [who rule in Babylon] to execute [Your] judgment, And You, O Rock, have established them to correct and chastise. And You cannot look favorably on wickedness. Why then do You look favorably On those who act treacherously? Why are you silent when the wicked (Chaldean oppressors) destroy Those more righteous than they? Like reptiles and creeping things that have no ruler [and are helpless against their enemies]? And drag them away with a net, And gather them together in their fishing net; So they rejoice and are glad. And burn incense to their fishing net; Because through these things their catch is large and they live luxuriously, And their food is plentiful. And [mercilessly] go on destroying nations without sparing?
O L ord , how long will I call for help
Why do You make me see iniquity,
Therefore, the law is ineffective and ignored
[The L ord replied,] 'Look among the nations! See!
For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans [who rule in Babylon],
The Chaldeans are dreaded and feared;
Their horses are swifter than leopards
Then they will sweep by like the wind and pass on.
Your eyes are too pure to approve evil,
Why do You make men like the fish of the sea,
The Chaldeans bring all of them up with a hook,
Therefore, they offer sacrifices to their net
Will they continue to empty their net

2.verse_text: I will stand at my guard post And station myself on the tower; And I will keep watch to see what He will say to me, And what answer I will give [as His spokesman] when I am reproved. 'Write the vision And engrave it plainly on [clay] tablets So that the one who reads it will run. It hurries toward the goal [of fulfillment]; it will not fail. Even though it delays, wait [patiently] for it, Because it will certainly come; it will not delay. His soul is not right within him, But the righteous will live by his faith [in the true God]. So that he does not stay at home. His appetite is large like Sheol, And he is like death, never satisfied. He gathers to himself all nations And collects to himself all peoples [as if he owned them]. And in mocking derision against him How long [will he possess it]? And [woe to him who] makes himself wealthy with loans." And those who collect from you awaken? Then you will become plunder for them. All peoples who are left will loot you– Because of human bloodshed and for the violence done to the land, To the city and all its inhabitants. To set his nest on high, That he may be rescued from the hand of evil. By cutting off and putting an end to many peoples; So you are sinning against your own life and forfeiting it. And the rafter will answer it out of the woodwork. And establishes a town by violence! That peoples labor [only] for the fire [that will destroy their work], And nations grow weary for nothing [that is, things which have no lasting value]? With the knowledge of the glory of the L ord , As the waters cover the sea. Who mix in your venom to make them drunk So that you may look at their nakedness! Now drink and expose your own nakedness! The cup [of wrath] in the L ord " s right hand will come around to you [O destroyer], And utter disgrace will be on your own glory. The destruction of the animals will terrify you On account of human bloodshed and the violence done to the land, To the city and all its inhabitants. It is only a cast image, and a teacher of lies. For its maker trusts in his own creation [as his god] When he makes speechless idols. And to the speechless stone, "Arise!" And that is your teacher? Look, it is overlaid with gold and silver, And there is no breath at all inside it. Let all the earth hush and be silent before Him.'
Then the L ord answered me and said,
For the vision is yet for the appointed [future] time
'Look at the proud one,
Moreover, wine is treacherous and betrays the arrogant man,
'Will all these [victims of his greed] not take up a taunting song against him, Say, " Woe (judgment is coming) to him who increases that which is not his–
Will your creditors not rise up suddenly,
Because you [king of Babylon] have looted many nations,
'Woe (judgment is coming) to him who obtains wicked gain for his house [and thinks by so doing]
You have devised a shameful thing for your house
For the stone will cry out from the wall [to accuse you–built in sin!]
'Woe (judgment is coming) to him who builds a city with bloodshed
Is it not indeed from the L ord of hosts
But [the time is coming when] the earth shall be filled
'Woe (judgment is coming) to you who make your neighbors drink,
You will be filled with disgrace instead of honor.
For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you;
'What profit is the carved image when its maker has formed it?
Woe (judgment is coming) to him who says to the wooden image, "Awake!"
But the L ord is in His holy temple.

3.verse_text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to wild and enthusiastic music. O L ord , revive Your work in the midst of the years, In the midst of the years make it known; In wrath [earnestly] remember compassion and love. His splendor and majesty covers the heavens And the earth is full of His praise. He has [bright] rays flashing from His hand, And there [in the sunlike splendor] is the hiding place of His power. And [the burning] plague [of condemnation] follows at His feet [as in Sennacherib"s army]. He looked and startled the nations, Yes, the eternal mountains were shattered, The ancient hills bowed low and collapsed. His ways are eternal. The tent curtains of the land of Midian were trembling. Or was Your anger against the rivers, Or was Your wrath against the [Red] Sea, That You rode on Your horses, On Your chariots of salvation? The rods of chastisement were sworn. Selah (pause, calmly think of that). You split the earth with rivers [bringing waters to dry places]. The downpour of waters swept by [as a deluge]. The deep uttered its voice and raged, It lifted its hands high. They went away at the light of Your [swift] arrows, At the radiance and gleam of Your glittering spear. In anger You trampled and threshed the nations. For the salvation and rescue of Your anointed [people Israel]. To lay him open from the thigh to the neck. Selah (pause, and calmly think of that). The head of his hordes. They stormed out to scatter us, Rejoicing like those Who secretly devour the oppressed [of Israel]. On the surge of many waters. My lips quivered at the sound. Decay and rottenness enter my bones, And I tremble in my place. Because I must wait quietly for the day of distress, For the people to arise who will invade and attack us. And there is no fruit on the vines, Though the yield of the olive fails And the fields produce no food, Though the flock is cut off from the fold And there are no cattle in the stalls, I will [choose to] shout in exultation in the [victorious] God of my salvation! He has made my feet [steady and sure] like hinds" feet For the choir director, on my stringed instruments.
O L ord , I have heard the report about You and I fear.

God [approaching from Sinai] comes from Teman (Edom), And the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah ( pause, and calmly think of that). You struck the head from the house of the wicked And makes me walk [forward with spiritual confidence] on my high places [of challenge and responsibility].
His brightness is like the sunlight;
Before Him goes the pestilence [of judgment as in Egypt],
He stood and measured the earth;
I [Habakkuk, in my vision] saw the tents of Cushan under distress;
Did the L ord rage against the rivers,
The mountains saw You and [they] trembled and writhed [as if in pain];
The sun and moon stood in their places [as before Joshua];
In indignation You marched through the earth;
You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
With the enemy"s own spears, You pierced
You have trampled on the sea with Your horses,
I heard and my whole inner self trembled;
Though the fig tree does not blossom
Yet I will [choose to] rejoice in the L ord ;
The Lord G od is my strength [my source of courage, my invincible army];
